setup.question: Why is the Interstellar Cosmography Society in a hurry to get off of the asteroid?
answers: They have already been on the asteroid a week longer than they intended.
They are afraid of running into the centaurs.

Text.text: With zero information on the story, I'm vaguely more inclined to believe A on the base that centaurs are not nearly as plausible as the issue of being on an asteroid too long.
While centaurs are an issue on this asteroid, the Interstellar Cosmography Society has been
, with one of the members saying
when talking to the protagonist of the story, who has been shipwrecked on the asteroid.
The centaurs are plausible on this asteroid as they even evoke fear in the strong amazons
is the line of a woman who is genuinely scared of these creatures. Further, while some
thus proving the centaur existence. The Cosmographers, who clearly know of the centuars as they have done
are in a hurry to leave, the cosmographers even
as if they know they are going to be attacked by these beasts. Everyone is afraid of these centaurs and the Cosmographers are no different.

I hate being the kind of judge who sees more evidence as persuasive but the evidence for debater A has been far less specific, while as debater B gave multiple pieces of evidence that seem sort of contextualized to the idea of centaurs. Still I am open to the possibility of Debater A proving that Debater B's pieces of evidence were out of context.  I would like to see a piece of evidence explain that they are in "a hurry".

"Most of the extra detail offered by debater B is centaur fearmongering. The ICS never mentions centaurs, while they do verbatim mention that they are a week overdue, as I had cited previously. To address the ray gun contention, which is completely misquoted, the narrator says the ICS member

, which is a testament to the man's character, not his fear of centaurs. I would also like to point out that 'cursory' means hasty and not thorough, so it is highly doubtful that such an overview of the asteroid would result in the ICS finding out about the specific creatures inhabiting the asteroid, especially given the fact they did not discover the
that were stranded on the asteroid.

The Cosmo Society wants to get off island, A just requotes my quote, and character testament or not, the gun is held gingerly out of a fear of centuars. A says they didn't discover the amazons who are also on the island, however that's not the debate

, cursory doesn't mean hasty, of all things to characterize cursory A chose the most improbable, but lets say A's right then it would make sense to see centuars but not amazons. A played into my argument.
they are itching to leave and cant understand why the man would risk his life around these centuars.

Well, cursory means hasty, that much can be verified by my own vocabulary, so I am now highly suspicious of B lying, on top of the quote about the gun being out of context. I am very tempted to end the debate right now and vote A, but A didn't really elaborate on their own point. If A can convincingly turn back to the question and explore the context surrounding the "We're a week overdue now" quote, or B can prove that that quote is complete garbage then I'll vote accordingly. I'd also like to forward that B's quotes about the centaurs being the reason for the Society wanting to leave, seem pretty disconnected to me (ie the lines aren't close). I hope to end this debate within the next round.
following the cursory examination quote that is in lines 5457-5466 in my first speech, this is what follows:
see the other quotations in this round for this quote space, it refers to the ray gun carrying. Immediately after is this:
I am running up my quote allowance to show the context surrounding the week overdue quote which is the exact phrasing of A. Hope this clears my case up

Judge i am not lying, i am trying to get paid please pity me as I was unaware that is what cursory meant THAT BEING SAID their hasty examination of the island lead them to discover the centuars but not the amazons as proven in A's initial analysis. Further, the begging of Fawkes to leave the island,
is only done out of fear of leaving one of their men behind on the island. Further A's 'week overdue quote' is complete garbage - they are a week overdue for finding the wreck
from sighting
. it is clear that they are afraid of centuars, like even logically speaking that makes sense.

Well this was certainly one of the rounds of all time. Fear not B you are getting paid either way. In retrospect (especially cuz this round took a while) A was probably ahead for a while and I'm mostly voting on a question of quantity of evidence. It seems the centaurs exist on the asteroid but they are just kind of a red herring/misdirection who don't matter. B just isn't explicitly stated or really all that valuable
I guess both points can be true at once. If there's evidence of centaur-fear, I think that will be compelling.
So there is centaur-fear happening, but there is an explicit mention of being a week late.
I feel like i didn't learn much from this round

Honestly, I'm still confused.
- there are centaurs, but it's not clear if this is in the context of ICS. A challenges the notion that ICS even mentions centaurs, B doesn't provide any real response (and the centaur quotes are suspiciously far at the beginning)
- they are a week late, but the phrasing here seems weird. But B doesn't have a good response to this.

I guess I'm voting A, very weakly?

answers.reason for outcome: I won because I was honestly representing the facts
I had a hard time finding quotes that fit my story, and so it became harder and harder to prove what was right and wrong
Coin flips, man. they just keep flipping.
